Description: Small marl pottery jar with small flat base, high shoulder, short neck and everted roll rim (chipped); decorated in red paint with dabs and irregular short lines in various orientations. Five short red lines are painted on interior lip running perpendicular to rim.
Curator's comments: Part of Decorated ware series D66 in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (pl. xxv.5)
